publications.title: Effect of Efpeglenatide on Heart Failure Outcomes: A Participant-Level Exploratory Analysis of the Randomized AMPLITUDE-O Trial.
Comparison of total event analysis and first event analysis in relation to heterogeneity in cardiovascular trials.
publications.abstract: In cardiovascular (CV) trials, analyzing the total number of events, rather than just time-to-first event, enhances understanding of participants' health. Adapting Cox models to account for between-subject heterogeneity in multiple events and understanding its impact plays crucial roles in total event analysis. publications.title: The Modern Role of Basal Insulin in Advancing Therapy in People With Type 2 Diabetes.
publications.abstract: Insulin deficiency, often aggravated by insulin resistance, results in type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). With the availability of glucagon-like peptide 1 receptor agonists and sodium-glucose cotransporter 2 inhibitors, basal insulin (BI) therapy is no longer the first-line option after lifestyle modification plus oral agents is insufficient. publications.title: Isolated Glucosuria in Adolescence and Early-Onset Diabetes: A Nationwide Cohort Study of 1.6 Million Adolescents.
publications.abstract: We assess diabetes risk in adulthood among adolescents with isolated glucosuria. Included were adolescents (16-19 years) examined before military service between 1993 and 2015. Data were linked with the Israeli National Diabetes Registry. Glucosuria was confirmed following normal renal function and glucose tolerance tests. Cox models were applied. publications.title: Leveraging Co-Design, Design Thinking, and Service Blueprinting to Create Digital Health Behavior Change Innovations: Insights From a Co-Design Workshop With Type 2 Diabetes Remission Health Coaches.
publications.journal: Journal of diabetes science and technology
publications.abstract: Digital health innovations are increasingly being designed to support chronic disease management. Digital health innovations may be particularly valuable for supporting health coaching interventions for type 2 diabetes (T2D) remission. To design more effective digitally enabled health coaching for T2D remission, design methods that utilize co-design, design thinking, and service blueprinting may be advantageous.
